title: Pseudorhaphitoma averina
text:
Pseudorhaphitoma averina is a small <a href="sea%20snail">sea snail</a>, a <a href="marine%20%28ocean%29">marine</a> <a href="gastropod">gastropod</a> <a href="mollusk">mollusk</a> in the family <a href="Mangeliidae">Mangeliidae</a>.
Description.
The length of the shell attains 6 mm, its diameter 2.75 mm.
(Original description) A stout, pure white little shell with an ovate-fusiform shape. It contains 7 <a href="Whorl%20%28mollusc%29">whorl</a>s of which two in the <a href="protoconch">protoconch</a>. It has strong ribs (7 in the <a href="body%20whorl">body whorl</a>), crossed by alternate strong or thin lirae, and gemmuled at the points of junction. The ovate <a href="Aperture%20%28mollusc%29">aperture</a> is narrow. The incrassate outer <a href="Lip%20%28gastropod%29">lip</a> and the columellar area are beautifully suffused with orange-yellow.
Distribution.
This marine genus occurs off <a href="Pakistan">Pakistan</a>
